alert.note: Alert for Niobrara County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 19 at 1:59PM MST until December 20 at 10:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM MST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory tonight, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Wind Chill Watch starting Wednesday night, extremely dangerous and life threatening cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 65 below zero. * WHERE...In Nebraska, Dawes County, Box Butte County and Northern Sioux County. In Wyoming, Niobrara County. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 11 PM this evening to 10 AM MST Tuesday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Wednesday afternoon through Friday morning. The most dangerous wind chills will occur Wednesday night and Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Wind chills of this magnitude can cause frostbite in less than 5 minutes if precautions are not taken. Hypothermia and death can also occur due to prolonged exposure to the cold.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
